author: Pierre Quatrelle
message:
Go for a non-proprietary coffee solution! I refuse to buy into any of these new coffee concepts, each forcing you into buying their particular capsule. I've seen some that propose 'universal' capsules but that doesn't solve the problem of unnecessary plastic waste.

Personally I've become a fan of the classic Italian cafetières with the hexagonal base. Good for making espressos, perhaps not so ideal for long coffees. And of course they don't do any of the myriad new nothing-at-all-like-coffee coffees full of creamy sugary pap, but hey, what's more cool, sitting on an Italian terrace watching the world go by with designer stubble, jacket and shades taking sips from a classic, raw, strong rich black coffee, or standing near a bin outside a Starbucks sucking mint cappuccino through a straw in front of a dustcart?

I may be exaggerating the two scenarios just a little. But the choice is yours!

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message: I generally agree with you, but now that I have this machine, I might as well make it last as long as possible. Regarding capsules, note original capsules are not made of plastic and that there are recycling points, so at least some recycling is done.
